alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:36PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT ...THE SOUTHWESTERN CITY OF NORFOLK...THE WESTERN CITY OF CHESAPEAKE...THE CITY OF PORTSMOUTH AND THE NORTHEASTERN CITY OF SUFFOLK THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 535 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Downtown Suffolk, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Churchland, Old Dominion University, Downtown Suffolk, Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Driver, Ghent, Cradock, Bowers Hill, Kings Fork, Western Branch, Suffolk Airport, Huntersville, Magnolia, Wilroy, and Kilby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
